title: Type ID Cold Case Files: May 2009
content:
Do you have what it takes to track down some fonts from our cold case files? The ID requests below were all posted during May 2009, but never got a response.

If you can resolve one, post your answer on the respective thread and let us know back here so we can track the results.

How many can you identify? Weâ€™ll (re)start the clock at the date/time of this posting.

Ready.. Set.. Go!

Also see: [January 2009](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202081904/http:/typophile.com/node/65293) | [February 2009](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202081904/http:/typophile.com/node/65359) | [March 2009](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202081904/http:/typophile.com/node/65382) | [April 2009](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202081904/http:/typophile.com/node/65413)

// SERIF

author: Jared Benson

comments.content:
Urban Outfitters seems to be [p22 Underground Thin Small Caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202081904/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/underground-basic/thin-small-caps/).

greetings Jeffrey  
 [infraordinaire](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202081904/http:/www.infraordinaire.com/wordpress)
